intro: Thesium multiflorum, commonly known as the many-flowered thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ericaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form with small, leathery leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pink, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom in late summer. Thesium multiflorum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to tolerate poor soil conditions.
